content:
I followed the directions in the playground's README.md and ui/README.md, but I don't know how to actually open the web page that lets me type in code and run it. If I open ui/frontend/build/index.html I get a page that looks right but it just emits an error upon trying to build/run code.

... Help?
Once you are running the backend (cargo run) you can go to http://127.0.0.1:5000
It's not unlikely that I've missed some steps in the READMEs.

I get a 404... but I got this from RUST_LOG=trace??

[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z TRACE hyper::http] should_keep_alive( Http11, Some(Connection([KeepAlive])) )
[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z TRACE playground_middleware::staticfile] Opening /home/ben/rust-playground/ui
[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z TRACE playground_middleware::staticfile] Redirecting to index /home/ben/rust-playground/ui/index.html
[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z TRACE hyper::header] Headers.set( "Content-Type", ContentType(Mime(Text, Html, [(Charset, Utf8)])) )
[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z TRACE hyper::header] Headers.set( "Content-Length", ContentLength(0) )
[2022-02-21T01:02:48Z DEBUG hyper::server::response] writing head: Http11 NotFound

OH I got it
You need to set the .env path to _the build directory_
The README just says "The path to the HTML, CSS, and Javascript files" which to me meant ui/frontend
Ben Kimock (Saethlin) has marked this topic as resolved.
Whatcha working on? :innocent:
